msg: Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Update action script files with asdoc version tags.
Doc Notes: Please review and update as necessary.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
A variety of fixes to Spinner and NumericStepper that exposed some inaccuracies in Range. All discovered while fixing SDK-17822.

Additionally, added the extractValueFunction which is the sibling property to displayFormatFunction. Both can be set on a Spark NumericStepper to modify the value displayed in the text input and to extract the correct value for internal representation.
Mustella tests: Pass (NS, Spinner, ScrollBar, Slider)
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
Bug fixes, notably support for "canceling" keyboard events that drive scrolling.  Added mouse-wheel scrolling to FxScroller.
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
SDK-17872 - Dragging Slider thumb has inconsistent behavior
Changed drag behavior. Possible drag values are multiples of valueInterval, not stepSize.
SDK-18082 - FxSlider cannot handle non-integer values
Copied over logic from Halo slider to handle floating point math errors
Other Changes: Using the keyboard to step the slider now uses valueInterval instead of stepSize to round off
Transferred from the Adobe Open Source Subversion Repository
FiFixed 17061, removed unnecessary override of 'set value' in FxNumericStepper
Previuosly FxSpinner::step() conflated stepSize and the
valueInterval property.  The latter forces FxRange values to be an
integer multiple of valueInterval, irrespective of the minimum.
I've changed FxSpinner::step() to leave enforcing the valueInterval
constraint to the value property.  So less the valueWrap logic, the
If the developer _also_ sets the valueInterval property, the new value
will still be forced to be a multiple.
I've also removed the unnecessary override of 'set value' in FxNumericStepper
QE: It's possible that some spinner/slide/scrollbar tests confirmed the old behavior
SDK-17061 - Gumbo Range does not allow an odd-only range
